2023.title: React
2023.description: A JavaScript library for building interactive UIs with a component-based architecture and virtual DOM.

2023.title: Vue.js
2023.description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

2023.title: Angular
2023.description: A full-featured TypeScript-based framework by Google for building large-scale single-page applications.

2023.title: Svelte
2023.description: A compiler that converts components into highly optimized JavaScript at build time, avoiding runtime overhead.

2023.title: Next.js
2023.description: A React framework from Vercel for server-side rendering, static site generation, and fullstack capabilities.

2023.title: Vite
2023.description: A next-generation frontend build tool that provides lightning-fast dev server and optimized production builds.

2023.title: esbuild
2023.description: An ultra-fast JavaScript and CSS bundler/minifier written in Go, used by tools like Vite.

2023.title: Tailwind CSS
2023.description: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs without leaving your HTML.

2023.title: TypeScript
2023.description: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript, improving tooling and reliability.

2023.title: Visual Studio Code
2023.description: A lightweight, extensible code editor with built-in terminal, debugger, and massive extension ecosystem.

2023.title: Git & GitHub
2023.description: Version control using Git and collaboration via GitHub remain essential in modern development workflows.

2023.title: HTMX
2023.description: A lightweight library to add AJAX, CSS transitions, and more directly in HTML using custom attributes.
